SWS and EWS events (table S1) were first defined to quantify the short- and long-term impacts of water shortage on crops. A grid cell was considered to be affected by water scarcity only if both the short-term water scarcity indicators (i.e., 1- and 3-month SPEI) and the long-term water scarcity indicators (i.e., 12-month SPEI) reached predefined thresholds (table S1). The thresholds were adopted on the basis of Blauhut et al. (
71 ), where the probability of drought impact occurrence was estimated on the basis of the impacts of drought on individual sectors. Because wheat is only grown during part of the year, we used two specific water scarcity sensitivity periods (SPs):
